intro: Erica remota, commonly known as the remote heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This evergreen shrub typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Erica remota produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in spring. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
